timeline.message: Temporary mapping of UnscheduledTrip from NeTEx to GTFS format

timeline.bodyText: I looked at the side-effect, it is very simple to remove it, just returning the result an add it here. I will provide a commit that do that.
timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText: Revert changing this file - this import is wrong.
timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText:
Suggestion: if (OTPFeature.FlexRouting.isOn() && frame.getFlexibleStopPlaces() != null) {
This should allow us to move this code into production, with Flex in the data and use the OTPFeature to toggle FLEX on off, even if there is problems in the import mapping.
timeline.author: t2gran
t2gran
t2gran

timeline.bodyText: This should be a WARNING not halt the build process.
timeline.author: t2gran
t2gran

timeline.bodyText: Move these mapping functions into a separat mapper, for example to OpenGisMapper. These are not part of Netex flex, but OpenGis. They are subject to reuse.
timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText: Class member fields passed to a class member function. No need to pass these on.
timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it be safe to always construct a multipolygon?
timeline.author: hannesj

replies.bodyText: We could construct a multipolygon here, but it would only contain one polygon, as we are mapping from OpenGIS polygon in the NeTEx XML.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

timeline.message: Clean code: Remove side-effect from FlexTripsMapper, saving flex trips to the builder during mapping.
Keep lambda in FlexTripMapper to get correct logger
